meanings.definition: To make (a problem, injury, or offense) worse or more serious.
meanings.sent2: Constant rain aggravates flooding in low-lying areas.
meanings.sent3: His loud chewing aggravates his sister during dinner.
meanings.sent4: Ignoring the warning signs only aggravates the impending disaster.
meanings.sent5: The lack of sleep aggravates his already bad mood.

meanings.sent1: The buzzing mosquito aggravates me at night.
meanings.sent2: Her constant questions aggravate her teacher.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy aggravates the older dog with its playful antics.
meanings.sent4: The repetitive sound of the dripping faucet aggravates her nerves.
meanings.sent5: The persistent sales calls aggravate him every evening.
